itemSummaries.title: Vintage Rolex Oyster WW2 Military Men’s Manual Watch - Serviced & Running
itemSummaries.shortDescription: For sale is a remarkable piece of horological history: a genuine Rolex-built Oyster from the World War II era. Produced circa 1944–1945, this timepiece boasts an all-original design with military styl...
itemSummaries.fullDescription:
For sale is a remarkable piece of horological history: a genuine Rolex-built Oyster from the World War II era. Produced circa 1944–1945, this timepiece boasts an all-original design with military styling and Rolex’s legendary engineering, making it a perfect addition for collectors and vintage watch enthusiasts.



Key Features:

• Brand: Oyster Watch Co. (Rolex)

• Production Year: Circa 1944–1945 (based on serial number 364255)

• Movement: Original Rolex Caliber 59, 17 Jewels (manual wind)

• Case Size: 30mm (excluding crown)

• Dial: Original cream-tone dial with bold Arabic numerals and heat-blued steel hands

• Bracelet: Brand new high-end black leather strap

• Caseback Reference (Exterior): 364255 (serial number)

• Caseback Reference (Interior): 4453 (Rolex case reference)

• Inner Caseback Markings: Stamped “Oyster Watch Co. Geneva–Swiss,” “Patented in All Countries,” and “R.W.C. LTD”



Condition Notes:


This WW2-era watch is in excellent vintage condition. The dial features a beautiful naturally aged patina consistent with its age. The hands are original and retain their period-correct styling. The movement is clean and fully functional, holding accurate time. The stainless steel case shows minor honest wear but retains sharp edges. A brand new high-end leather strap has been fitted, but all other parts are original.



Historical Significance:


While the dial is signed “Oyster” and not “Rolex,” this watch was built by Rolex during World War II under its Oyster Watch Co. sub-brand. At the time, Rolex used this name to work around wartime tariffs and import restrictions, especially in markets like the UK and Canada. These watches featured Rolex’s patented waterproof Oyster case, robust in-house movements, and overall Rolex craftsmanship—just without the Rolex branding on the dial due to legal and logistical limitations.


The serial number (364255) dates this watch to around 1944–1945, directly aligning it with the WWII period. The interior caseback is marked with reference 4453, a known Rolex case reference used for smaller Oyster models housing the Caliber 59 movement. Also inside the caseback are factory markings that read “Oyster Watch Co. Geneva–Swiss,” and “R.W.C. LTD” (Rolex Watch Company Ltd)—definitive proof of its Rolex origin.



Whether you’re a vintage Rolex collector or a fan of military-issued timepieces, this Oyster is a rare and important watch with a direct link to Rolex’s wartime production strategy. It combines historical intrigue, original craftsmanship, and robust Swiss construction—all in a compact, military-style package.



Please Note:

This watch is sold as-is in vintage condition. While it is currently running and keeping accurate time, no guarantees are made regarding long-term accuracy or water resistance due to its age.


Feel free to reach out with any questions or for additional photos. Don’t miss this opportunity to own a fascinating and historical Rolex-built military timepiece.

itemSummaries.title: Vintage Bulova Art Deco Enamel Miss America Watch
itemSummaries.shortDescription: The Bulova Miss America was one of the most elegant and sought-after ladies’ watches of the 1920s. First introduced during the height of the Art Deco era, this timepiece was renowned for its distincti...
itemSummaries.fullDescription:
The Bulova Miss America was one of the most elegant and sought-after ladies’ watches of the 1920s. First introduced during the height of the Art Deco era, this timepiece was renowned for its distinctive design, fine craftsmanship, and vibrant enamel detailing. The Miss America model was a statement piece of luxury and sophistication, often adorned with decorative elements that reflected the fashion trends of the roaring twenties.


Key Features:

• Brand: Bulova

• Model: Miss America (1927)

• Case Material: 14K Gold-Filled with Enamel Detailing

• Case Size: 12mm x 34mm (excluding crown)

• Movement: Mechanical, Hand-Wound

• Functionality: Running and Keeping Accurate Time

• Dial: Original with Aged Patina

• Band: Brand New Ostrich Leather Strap

• Lug Width: Fixed

• Era: Art Deco (1920s)


This stunning timepiece remains a remarkable example of 1920s watch design, with its beautiful enameled case and intricate detailing. The watch is in working condition and keeps time well, making it a fantastic addition to any vintage watch collection or a thoughtful gift for a collector of Art Deco jewelry.


Please review the photos carefully for condition details. Feel free to ask any questions or request additional images before purchase.


Note: This is a vintage timepiece being sold as-is. While it is currently running and accurate, no long-term guarantees are made due to its age.

Vintage Elgin Men’s Art Deco Fancy Dial 14k WGF Engraved Watch
itemSummaries.shortDescription: Up for sale is a beautifully preserved vintage Elgin men’s wristwatch, a stunning example of early American Art Deco craftsmanship. This timepiece features a 14K white gold filled case adorned with in...
itemSummaries.fullDescription:
Up for sale is a beautifully preserved vintage Elgin men’s wristwatch, a stunning example of early American Art Deco craftsmanship. This timepiece features a 14K white gold filled case adorned with intricate geometric engravings along the bezel, sides, and lugs, making it a standout collector’s piece with exceptional visual appeal.


The watch is powered by a 17-jewel Elgin USA movement (serial 32703004), which has been recently serviced and is running smoothly, holding accurate time. It is housed in a 29mm x 32mm curved rectangular case, perfectly sized for the period and very comfortable on the wrist.


The dial is classic vintage Elgin—clean and well-preserved—with stylized numerals, blued steel hands, and a recessed sub-seconds dial at 6 o’clock. The case back is free of personal engravings and closes tightly.


This watch comes fitted on a brand new high-end black leather strap, adding a touch of modern refinement to its vintage charm.


Key Features:

• Case Size: 29mm (width excluding crown) x 32mm (lug to lug)

• Movement: Manual wind, 17 jewels, Elgin USA

• Case Material: 14K White Gold Filled

• Condition: Excellent overall; see photos for best assessment

• Strap: New high-end black leather strap (non-original)

• Runs and keeps accurate time


Don’t miss your chance to own a piece of American horological history with timeless Art Deco style.

Vintage Swiss Army Texswiss Dual Compass Quartz Military Mint Watch
itemSummaries.shortDescription: For sale is a vintage Texswiss Compass Watch in exceptional, nearly new condition. This Swiss-made timepiece features a rugged, tactical design complete with an integrated analog compass, a rotating b...
itemSummaries.fullDescription:
For sale is a vintage Texswiss Compass Watch in exceptional, nearly new condition. This Swiss-made timepiece features a rugged, tactical design complete with an integrated analog compass, a rotating bezel, and a highly legible dial with luminous hands and indices. The quartz movement is reliable and currently running with a brand-new battery, keeping accurate time.


The case and band with full links are in outstanding condition, showing minimal if any signs of wear. The compass watch head can be swiveled out for viewing. This model is shockproof, waterproof to 100M (10 ATM), and built with all stainless steel components for durability.


Brand History:

Texswiss was a niche Swiss watchmaker known for producing durable and function-forward timepieces during the late 20th century. Marketed in the U.S. through the Atlantic Eastern Corporation, Texswiss watches gained popularity for their reliability, affordability, and rugged aesthetics—especially models like this compass-equipped sport watch that catered to adventurers, outdoor enthusiasts, and tactical users.


Features:

• Swiss Quartz Movement

• Waterproof 100M / 10 ATM

• Case size: 47mm

• Integrated Analog Compass

• Detachable Watch Head / Modular Design

• Full Links

• Stainless Steel Caseback

• Shockproof Construction


Condition:

• Running and keeping time accurately

• New battery installed

• Mint to near-mint cosmetic condition

• All functions working properly



Feel free to reach out with any questions or photo requests!

itemSummaries.title: Vintage Waltham A-17 MIL-W-6433 Hack US Military Issued Men’s Watch
itemSummaries.shortDescription: For sale is a stunning and authentic vintage Waltham A-17 Military Navigation Watch, issued by the U.S. Military under MIL-W-6433 specifications. This is a true collector’s piece and a near-perfect ex...
itemSummaries.fullDescription:
For sale is a stunning and authentic vintage Waltham A-17 Military Navigation Watch, issued by the U.S. Military under MIL-W-6433 specifications. This is a true collector’s piece and a near-perfect example of a historically significant timepiece from the early Cold War era.


Details & Condition:

• Manufacturer: Waltham Watch Co.

• Model: A-17, Type A-17 Navigation Watch

• Case Size: 32mm (excluding crown)

• Case Material: Stainless steel

• Movement: Manual wind, 17 jewels, Waltham U.S.A. marked, running strong

• Hack Feature: Fully functional and precise (seconds hand stops when crown is pulled)

• Dial: Original black dial with beautifully aged patina on the luminous numerals and hands

• Crystal: Clear acrylic, excellent condition

• Case Back: Marked with full U.S. military specifications and contract/order numbers

• Bracelet: NOS vintage stainless steel Bonklip bracelet – correct for the era and looks fantastic

• Condition: Excellent – Running accurately, fully serviced, and ready to wear or display


Historical Significance:


The Waltham A-17 is a military navigation watch issued in the 1950s to U.S. Air Force and other service members. Built to MIL-W-6433 standards, this watch was designed for precision and reliability in extreme conditions. It replaced earlier WWII models and introduced refinements like improved luminous markers and a hacking seconds feature – essential for synchronized military operations.


Unlike civilian watches, these were government-issued and property of the U.S. military, as noted on the case back. The fact that this example still has a fully functional hacking feature and a clean, crisp dial makes it an exceptional survivor.


This watch is not only a functional timekeeper but a piece of military history. These were used during critical Cold War missions, training exercises, and flights—each one tells a story.


Why This Watch is Special:

• Authentic U.S. Military-issued watch with full markings

• All-original dial with gorgeous patina

• Functioning hack feature – rare to find fully operational

• Clean, unrestored movement in excellent shape

• Comes with a period-correct Bonklip bracelet – a NOS example

• A rare and investment-worthy timepiece


Don’t miss your chance to own a well-preserved piece of horological and military history.



Please Note: This watch is sold as-is, in vintage condition, with no guarantees regarding future accuracy due to its age.

itemSummaries.title: Vintage Elgin Art Deco Fancy Enamel Dial Men’s 7J Manual Engraved Cushion Watch
Vintage Seiko Super Runners S750-0AA1 Men’s Atomic Radio Solar Digital Watch JDM
Vintage Elgin Art Deco Fancy Enamel Dial 7J Men’s Manual Cushion Case Watch
itemSummaries.fullDescription:
For sale is a charming vintage Elgin men’s wristwatch, featuring a beautifully ornate Art Deco enamel dial housed in a cushion-shaped nickel case. This timepiece showcases the elegant styling of late 1920s American wristwatch design, highlighted by a cream-and-white enamel dial with bold black numerals and intricate gold detailing encircling each hour. The ornate Louis XV-style hands and subsidiary seconds dial at 6 o’clock further enhance its refined period character.

Powering this watch is a 7-jewel manual wind movement signed Elgin U.S.A., with a movement serial number 15565730 dating it to approximately 1910. The movement is running smoothly and holding accurate time.

The case, made by Scepter, is crafted from nickel and features a classic rounded cushion profile with fixed wire lugs. The inside case back is marked with serial number 7034516. The case measures approximately 32mm (excluding crown), offering a comfortable and elegant fit on the wrist. The watch is fitted with a brand new high-end gray leather strap, complementing the dial and enhancing its ready-to-wear appeal.

Key Features:
• Brand: Elgin
• Style: Art Deco
• Dial: Cream and white enamel with black numerals and gold detailing
• Hands: Louis XV-style ornate hands
• Case Shape: Cushion
• Case Size: 32mm (excluding crown)
• Case Material: Nickel
• Case Maker: Scepter
• Case Serial #: 7034516
• Movement: 7-jewel manual wind
• Movement Serial #: 15565730 (circa 1910)
• Strap: Brand new high-end gray leather strap
• Condition: Fully functional, running, and holding accurate time; excellent overall condition — see photos for the best representation

This elegant vintage Elgin is a wonderful example of early American wristwatch craftsmanship and a beautiful addition to any Art Deco or antique watch collection.
